website_summaries.verdict: The HTC Desire 610 may be affordable, with an iPhone 5C-style plastic body, but its mediocre specs and poor screen resolution mean it's still not a good buy. For much less money you can grab the 4G Motorola Moto G, which has the same processor, Android KitKat software and a higher resolution display.
pros: The HTC Desire 610 has an affordable price tag, its camera isn't too bad and its navy-blue, plastic body is quite fun
cons: It has a very disappointingly low resolution display that's not too bright either
Its processor and Android version are the same as the considerably cheaper Motorola Moto G. Its battery is only adequate

customer_reviews.title: Good Phone, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great phone, I bought it used like new, and it seemed to be in perfect condition upon arrival. People have commented about the screen not being very high resolution, but the image and video quality has seemed quite satisfactory to me. The android user interface is very easy to navigate, and the structure and layout of the physical device seems solid and well thought out. UPDATE: I have now had this device for almost 4 years, and it is performing just as well as it did on day 1. Battery life is excellent and apps don't freeze.
customer_reviews.author: Izzos

customer_reviews.title: Important info if you want to use it on a t-mobile network
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone in order to use it on the t-mobile network, however, the Sim size of the phone is a Nano while I had a micro Sim card. After some cuts on my micro Sim card, I was able to make it work perfectly. Also, in order to get data connection for t-mobile you need to insert a network manually, there's several videos on youtube that show step by step how to do it. Other than that, the phone has worked perfectly and the packaging was perfect as well.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Fine unlocked phone at okay price

customer_reviews.title: Dead Phone needs life
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone in December 2016. There was no external injury or insult but after just short of 2 months the thing stopped working!! No led lights appeared, completely dead. Tried starting it up according to the Manufacturing requirements....and nothing! The Manufacturer claims they cannot do anything unless i was in the USA. and it would cost me for the repairs. Just that it does not sound practical.  Had two other HTC phones in the past and they were superb and attempted to buy this one for my third... which was disappointing. "Dont put all your investment into one kind of product". "Diversity is Good"
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. James

customer_reviews.title: A good to great cellphone
customer_reviews.text: I had use the phone for a week. Strong signal, easy to use and navigate, right size, looks great, battery is holding 2 full days. So far I found just one issue: the calculator is really poor, it needs a serious update. The basic camera is average; however, if you play with the setting you will see a serious improvement. The construction is plastic, so I recommend a case. Compared to newer phones it looks just OK but the size and functions are above average. Update After few months, this is a great phone for the price.
customer_reviews.author: RAP

customer_reviews.title: Said New, Later Found Out it Was Refurbished After Trying to Get Wifi Fixed
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my uncle, after using it for about half a year, the wifi function no longer works. Tried resetting, etc, and none of it worked. Finally took it into AT&T customer service center and see if they know of other tricks to get the wifi going again. The guy looked up the phone info, and found out the phone was previously sold in 2014, and what I bought was actually a refurbished phone.

On the other hand, it's durable because of the plastic casing and easy to use for the most part. The call quality is okay, the battery is not as long-lasting as the higher end phones.

The screen size and specs are adequate for basic browsing. If you just need a phone to be a phone, this is a great option. We use this with trac-fone prepaid plans, as we do not have need for large amounts of data transfer or minutes per month, which makes it a very affordable option for smartphone use.

product_meta.title: HTC Desire 610 8GB Unlocked GSM 4G LTE Quad-Core Android 4.4 Smartphone - Black (No Warranty)
product_meta.description: HTC Desire 610 8GB Unlocked GSM 4G LTE Quad-Core Android 4.4 Smartphone - Black (No Warranty).2G: GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900, 3G: HSDPA 850 / 1900 / 2100, 4G: LTE 850 / 1900 / 2100 (Bands 2, 4, 5 and 17).4.7" Capacitive Multi-Touchscreen w/ HTC Sense UI 5.5.Android v4.4.2 (KitKat), Quad-Core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7 Processor, Chipset: Qualcomm Snapdragon 4, Adreno 305 Graphics.8 Megapixel Camera (3264 x 2448 pixels) w/ Autofocus & LED Flash + Front-Facing 1.3 Megapixel Camera.Internal Memory: 8GB, 1GB RAM + microSD Slot Expandable up to 128GB.Unlocked cell phones are compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T and T-Mobile as well as with GSM SIM cards (e.g. H20, Straight Talk, and select prepaid carriers). Unlocked cell phones will not work with CDMA Carriers like Sprint, Verizon, Boost or Virgin.
feature_bullets: 4.7" Capacitive Multi-Touchscreen w/ HTC Sense UI 5.5
Android v4.4.2 (KitKat), Quad-Core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7 Processor, Chipset: Qualcomm Snapdragon 4, Adreno 305 Graphics
8 Megapixel Camera (3264 x 2448 pixels) w/ Autofocus & LED Flash + Front-Facing 1.3 Megapixel Camera
Internal Memory: 8GB, 1GB RAM + microSD Slot Expandable up to 128GB

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars240 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: Touchscreen, Built-in-gps, Mobile-hotspot-capability, Dual-camera, Lte, Smartphone
